8.Pros: The company offers a Flexible schedule- am or pm shifts. The Job is very easy with simple and thorough training.
8.Cons: When I worked there, there were no benefits offered. There is little to no room for advancement. But it’s a good job to get you through college.

9.Pros: Awesome managers that you can crack jokes with, the co-workers are all great. You get put down by customers quite often if your customer service and shouted at if your in the grill, but do your job right and it's a pretty good job for a beginner or someone looking to take it easy
9.Cons: Raises are not given to those who work hard, but for those who work more. If you have a set availability, you won't get a raise past 8.25. (That is what I've been told) so you need to have an open availability to move up to management or to make more money
